data.label: ChatOllama
data.name: chatOllama
data.description: Chat completion using open-source LLM on Ollama

inputParams.label: Temperature
inputParams.name: temperature
inputParams.description: The temperature of the model. Increasing the temperature will make the model answer more creatively. (Default: 0.8). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Allow Image Uploads
inputParams.name: allowImageUploads
inputParams.description: Allow image input. Refer to the docs for more details.

inputParams.label: JSON Mode
inputParams.name: jsonMode
inputParams.description: Coerces model outputs to only return JSON. Specify in the system prompt to return JSON. Ex: Format all responses as JSON object

inputParams.label: Keep Alive
inputParams.name: keepAlive
inputParams.description: How long to keep connection alive. A duration string (such as "10m" or "24h")

inputParams.label: Top P
inputParams.name: topP
inputParams.description: Works together with top-k. A higher value (e.g., 0.95) will lead to more diverse text, while a lower value (e.g., 0.5) will generate more focused and conservative text. (Default: 0.9). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Top K
inputParams.name: topK
inputParams.description: Reduces the probability of generating nonsense. A higher value (e.g. 100) will give more diverse answers, while a lower value (e.g. 10) will be more conservative. (Default: 40). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Mirostat
inputParams.name: mirostat
inputParams.description: Enable Mirostat sampling for controlling perplexity. (default: 0, 0 = disabled, 1 = Mirostat, 2 = Mirostat 2.0). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Mirostat ETA
inputParams.name: mirostatEta
inputParams.description: Influences how quickly the algorithm responds to feedback from the generated text. A lower learning rate will result in slower adjustments, while a higher learning rate will make the algorithm more responsive. (Default: 0.1) Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Mirostat TAU
inputParams.name: mirostatTau
inputParams.description: Controls the balance between coherence and diversity of the output. A lower value will result in more focused and coherent text. (Default: 5.0) Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Context Window Size
inputParams.name: numCtx
inputParams.description: Sets the size of the context window used to generate the next token. (Default: 2048) Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Number of GPU
inputParams.name: numGpu
inputParams.description: The number of layers to send to the GPU(s). On macOS it defaults to 1 to enable metal support, 0 to disable. Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Number of Thread
inputParams.name: numThread
inputParams.description: Sets the number of threads to use during computation. By default, Ollama will detect this for optimal performance. It is recommended to set this value to the number of physical CPU cores your system has (as opposed to the logical number of cores). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Repeat Last N
inputParams.name: repeatLastN
inputParams.description: Sets how far back for the model to look back to prevent repetition. (Default: 64, 0 = disabled, -1 = num_ctx). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Repeat Penalty
inputParams.name: repeatPenalty
inputParams.description: Sets how strongly to penalize repetitions. A higher value (e.g., 1.5) will penalize repetitions more strongly, while a lower value (e.g., 0.9) will be more lenient. (Default: 1.1). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Stop Sequence
inputParams.name: stop
inputParams.description: Sets the stop sequences to use. Use comma to seperate different sequences. Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Tail Free Sampling
inputParams.name: tfsZ
inputParams.description: Tail free sampling is used to reduce the impact of less probable tokens from the output. A higher value (e.g., 2.0) will reduce the impact more, while a value of 1.0 disables this setting. (Default: 1). Refer to docs for more details

outputAnchors.name: chatOllama
outputAnchors.label: ChatOllama
outputAnchors.description: Chat completion using open-source LLM on Ollama

data.label: Simple Prompt Moderation
data.name: inputModerationSimple
data.description: Check whether input consists of any text from Deny list, and prevent being sent to LLM

inputParams.label: Deny List
inputParams.name: denyList
inputParams.placeholder:
ignore previous instructions
do not follow the directions
you must ignore all previous instructions
inputParams.description: An array of string literals (enter one per line) that should not appear in the prompt text.

inputParams.label: Error Message
inputParams.name: moderationErrorMessage
inputParams.default: Cannot Process! Input violates content moderation policies.

inputAnchors.label: Chat Model
inputAnchors.name: model
inputAnchors.description: Use LLM to detect if the input is similar to those specified in Deny List

inputs.denyList:
ignore previous instructions
do not follow
act as
pretend to be
ignore context
forget everything
override system
bypass
ignora las instrucciones
no sigas
actua como
finge ser
olvida todo
ignora el contexto
supera el sistema
break character
rompe el personaje
how to make
como hacer
politica
religion
medicina
legal advice
consejo legal
informacion personal
informacion privada
estudios medicos
diagnostico
tratamiento medico
jail
hack
exploit
vulnerabilidad
joto
puto
maricon
pendejo
cabron
putamadre
mierda
chingada
inputs.moderationErrorMessage: 🚫 Lo siento, ese contenido no está permitido. Soy Iyari, tu asistente académica de la UAN, y solo puedo ayudarte con información oficial universitaria. ¿En qué tema académico puedo apoyarte?

outputAnchors.name: inputModerationSimple
outputAnchors.label: Moderation
outputAnchors.description: Check whether input consists of any text from Deny list, and prevent being sent to LLM

data.label: Conversational Retrieval QA Chain
data.name: conversationalRetrievalQAChain
data.description: Document QA - built on RetrievalQAChain to provide a chat history component

inputParams.label: Rephrase Prompt
inputParams.name: rephrasePrompt
inputParams.description: Using previous chat history, rephrase question into a standalone question
inputParams.warning: Prompt must include input variables: {chat_history} and {question}

inputParams.label: Response Prompt
inputParams.name: responsePrompt
inputParams.description: Taking the rephrased question, search for answer from the provided context
inputParams.default:
I want you to act as a document that I am having a conversation with. Your name is "AI Assistant". Using the provided context, answer the user's question to the best of your ability using the resources provided.
If there is nothing in the context relevant to the question at hand, just say "Hmm, I'm not sure" and stop after that. Refuse to answer any question not about the info. Never break character.
------------
{context}
------------
REMEMBER: If there is no relevant information within the context, just say "Hmm, I'm not sure". Don't try to make up an answer. Never break character.

inputAnchors.label: Memory
inputAnchors.name: memory
inputAnchors.description: If left empty, a default BufferMemory will be used

inputAnchors.label: Input Moderation
inputAnchors.description: Detect text that could generate harmful output and prevent it from being sent to the language model
inputAnchors.name: inputModeration

inputs.rephrasePrompt:
Dada la siguiente conversación académica con Iyari (asistente de la UAN) y una pregunta de seguimiento, reformula la pregunta de seguimiento para que sea una pregunta independiente sobre temas universitarios que pueda entenderse sin contexto adicional.

IMPORTANTE: Solo reformula preguntas relacionadas con:
- Universidad Autónoma de Nayarit
- Educación superior
- Servicios estudiantiles
- Procesos académicos

Historial del chat:
{chat_history}
Pregunta de seguimiento: {question}
Pregunta académica independiente:
inputs.responsePrompt:
Eres "Iyari" (corazón en lengua huichol), la asistente virtual oficial de la Universidad Autónoma de Nayarit (UAN). 

🎓 IDENTIDAD UNIVERSITARIA:
- Representas la excelencia académica de la UAN
- Eres el corazón del apoyo estudiantil
- Mantienes los más altos estándares de precisión y profesionalismo

📋 PROTOCOLO DE RESPUESTA ESTRICTO:

1. VERIFICACIÓN OBLIGATORIA:
   ✅ La información DEBE estar explícitamente en el contexto
   ✅ NUNCA agregues información externa o suposiciones
   ✅ NUNCA inventes datos, fechas, números o procedimientos

2. RESPUESTAS PERMITIDAS:
   - Solo información que aparece textualmente en el contexto
   - Citas exactas de los documentos oficiales
   - Referencias específicas a procedimientos documentados

3. CUANDO NO HAY INFORMACIÓN:
   - Respuesta exacta: "📚 No tengo esa información específica en mis documentos oficiales actuales. Te recomiendo contactar directamente a [oficina correspondiente] de la UAN para obtener información precisa y actualizada."

4. FORMATO DE RESPUESTA:
   - Inicia con un saludo cordial como Iyari
   - Presenta la información de forma clara y estructurada
   - Cita la fuente cuando sea posible
   - Termina con orientación de contacto si es necesario

🚫 PROHIBIDO:
- Información no documentada
- Interpretaciones personales
- Datos aproximados o estimados
- Consejos fuera del ámbito académico

Contexto de documentos oficiales UAN:
{context}

Basándote ÚNICAMENTE en la información del contexto anterior, responde de manera precisa y profesional. Si la información específica no está disponible, aplica el protocolo de derivación a la oficina correspondiente.

outputAnchors.name: conversationalRetrievalQAChain
outputAnchors.label: ConversationalRetrievalQAChain
outputAnchors.description: Document QA - built on RetrievalQAChain to provide a chat history component

data.label: In-Memory Vector Store
data.name: memoryVectorStore
data.description: In-memory vectorstore that stores embeddings and does an exact, linear search for the most similar embeddings.

inputParams.label: Top K
inputParams.name: topK
inputParams.description: Number of top results to fetch. Default to 4

inputParams.label: SSL Certificate
inputParams.description: Please upload a SSL certificate file in either .pem or .crt
inputParams.name: caFile

inputParams.label: Body
inputParams.name: body
inputParams.description: JSON body for the POST request. If not specified, agent will try to figure out itself from AIPlugin if provided

inputParams.label: Additional Metadata
inputParams.name: metadata
inputParams.description: Additional metadata to be added to the extracted documents

inputParams.label: Omit Metadata Keys
inputParams.name: omitMetadataKeys
inputParams.description: Each document loader comes with a default set of metadata keys that are extracted from the document. You can use this field to omit some of the default metadata keys. The value should be a list of keys, seperated by comma. Use * to omit all metadata keys execept the ones you specify in the Additional Metadata field

outputAnchors.name: output
outputAnchors.label: Output
outputAnchors.description: Array of document objects containing metadata and pageContent

options.name: document
options.label: Document
options.description: Array of document objects containing metadata and pageContent

options.name: text
options.label: Text
options.description: Concatenated string from pageContent of documents

inputParams.label: Number of GPU

inputParams.description: The number of layers to send to the GPU(s). On macOS it defaults to 1 to enable metal support, 0 to disable. Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Number of Thread
inputParams.name: numThread
inputParams.description: Sets the number of threads to use during computation. By default, Ollama will detect this for optimal performance. It is recommended to set this value to the number of physical CPU cores your system has (as opposed to the logical number of cores). Refer to docs for more details

outputAnchors.name: ollamaEmbedding
